nodes.bodyText: Instead of doing this, how about just setting the bound size to the target type and then later, check the remainder of the source type members against the rest type?
Changed
Changed
Changed
Done
We don't need a new list now, right?
It is added, because targetType.getTupleTypes() is used several times in the method.
Yes, changed
Why do we return false when sourceTypeSize == targetTypeSize ?
Changed.

Why do we have to use special methods checkTupleElementType and getArrayElementType here and in the next for loop?
Can't (shouldn't) we directly call
checkIsLikeType(source.getRefValue(i), targetTypes.get(i), unresolvedValues, allowNumericConversion)?
Changed.
Fixed.
Isn't it definitely an error if sourceTypeSize < targetTypeSize irrespective of whether or not there is a rest descriptor? Shouldn't we check that and return false as the first check?
That is correct, changed.
Shouldn't this be in a different test since there's no rest descriptor here?
Yes, changed
Shall we also add tests for where the source size is less than the target tuple member size?
Added
